result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 5, 2023 at 11:45 am.

11:01 AM Defendant John Kirk Horton appeared by video.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for John Kirk Horton.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel  requests status in 90 days.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 11:45 am.
Request by Defendant and Aty for Defendant to appear via ZOOM. ZOOM info provided to Def by phone. PP

ADDRESS INFO for John Kirk Horton
Current: 1008 Harvey Street, Apt 1, Green Bay, WI 54302 United States  (Effective: 09-21-2022)
Prior: 1547 Egg Harbor Rd, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:45 AM  Defendant John Kirk Horton in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for John Kirk Horton.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests 90 days to work out a few matters with the State.  State has no objection to adjournment.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with J.D. and J.A. except for incidental contact in apartment building.

3:00 PM Defendant John Kirk Horton appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Shannon Viel appeared by video for John Horton. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Defense waives reading of formal criminal complaint, enters not guilty plea.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
